description: [ISS] Unlike its ambiguous response to the Russia-Ukraine war, the AU's position on the destruction of Gaza has been clear.
title: Africa: Why the African Union Should Weigh in On the Gaza Crisis

description: [WHO] A Joint Statement from Chairs, Co-Chairs, Principals, Members and Advisors to The Elders, The Global Preparedness Monitoring Board, The Independent Panel for Pandemic Preparedness and Response, Pandemic Action Network, The Panel for a Global Public Health Convention and Spark Street Advisors
title: Africa: Pandemic Agreement Needs Better Modalities, Inclusion, and Transparency

description: [African Women in Agricultural Research and Development] African Women in Agricultural Research and Development (AWARD) announces new fellowship for women in   Benin, Cameroon, Ghana, Kenya, Malawi and Senegal working on climate adaptation solutions.
title: Africa: New Project Aims to Promote African Women's Leadership in Climate Action

description: [Mastercard Foundation] The Mastercard Foundation, an international non-governmental organization, kicked off its inaugural EdTech conference today with an important question.
title: Africa: Mastercard Foundation Convenes Edtech Conference on Resilient and Inclusive Learning in Africa

description: [Independent (Kampala)] From just making calls, to taking pictures and light browsing, to engaging in e-commerce transactions to, recently, engaging in digital activism, the way Africans are engaging with their smartphones is fast evolving. This is happening against the backdrop of a surge in smartphone usage across the continent, according to three recent reports.
title: Africa: Rise of Digital Activism in Africa As Smartphone Adoption Surges

description: [Afropop] Summer is upon us full force, and nothing sounds better in summer than music from the continent and its global diaspora. Here are seven new video offerings for you to keep the summer vibe going.
title: Africa: Afropop Top Videos - YG Marley, Yemi Alade, Tinariwen, Qoha and More!

description: [The New Humanitarian] Johannesburg -- 'There is a crisis on the demand and supply side of the equation.'
title: Africa: The Changing Face of Peacekeeping - What's Gone Wrong With the UN?

description: [The Conversation Africa] When fiction's most famous detective, Sherlock Holmes, needed to solve a crime, he turned to his sharp observational skills and deep understanding of human nature. He used this combination more than once when facing off against his arch-nemesis, Dr James Moriarty, a villain adept at exploiting human weaknesses for his gain.
title: Africa: Catching Online Scammers - Our Model Combines Data and Behavioural Science to Map the Psychological Games Cybercriminals Play

description: [UN News] Eight athletes and one guide runner are set to compete in the Paris 2024 Paralympic Games as the largest-ever Refugee Paralympic Team, the International Paralympic Committee announced on Tuesday.
title: Africa: 'Off-the-Charts Awe Inspiring' Refugee Paralympic Team Heading to Paris

description: [The Conversation Africa] There is often much debate about who is the greatest among sportsmen and women, movie stars, leaders or artists. But some scholars have truly made a staggering difference to the world.
title: Africa: The Five Scholars Who Won Two Nobel Prizes - and What Sets Them Apart
